net.unto.twitter
Class Api

java.lang.Object
  net.unto.twitter.Api

public class Api
extends Object

Instances of the Api class provide access to the Twitter web service.

Author:
dewitt@google.com

Method Detail

getPublicTimeline

public Status[] getPublicTimeline()
                           throws TwitterException
Returns the 20 most recent statuses from non-protected users who have set a custom user icon. Does not require authentication.

Returns:
an array of Status instances
Throws:
TwitterException

getPublicTimeline

public Status[] getPublicTimeline(Long sinceId)
                           throws TwitterException
Returns the 20 most recent statuses from non-protected users who have set a custom user icon. Does not require authentication.

Parameters:
sinceId - Optional. Returns only public statuses with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.
Returns:
an array of Status instances
Throws:
TwitterException

getFriendsTimeline

public Status[] getFriendsTimeline()
                            throws TwitterException
Returns the 20 most recent statuses posted in the last 24 hours from the authenticating user and that user's friends.

Returns:
an array of Status instances
Throws:
TwitterException

getFriendsTimeline

public Status[] getFriendsTimeline(String id)
                            throws TwitterException
Returns the 20 most recent statuses posted in the last 24 hours from the authenticating user and that user's friends.

Parameters:
id - Optional. Specifies the ID or screen name of the user for whom to return the friends_timeline. Requires credentials if the id is not set, or if the id is private.
Returns:
an array of Status instances
Throws:
TwitterException

getFriendsTimeline

public Status[] getFriendsTimeline(String id,
                                   DateTime since,
                                   Integer page)
                            throws TwitterException
Returns the 20 most recent statuses posted in the last 24 hours from the authenticating user and that user's friends.

Parameters:
id - Optional. Specifies the ID or screen name of the user for whom to return the friends_timeline. Requires credentials if the id is not set, or if the id is private.
since - Optional. Narrows the returned results to just those statuses created after the specified HTTP-formatted date.
page - Optional. Gets the 20 next most recent statuses from the authenticating user and that user's friends.
Returns:
an array of Status instances
Throws:
TwitterException

getUserTimeline

public Status[] getUserTimeline()
                         throws TwitterException
Returns the 20 most recent statuses posted in the last 24 hours from the authenticating user.

Returns:
an array of Status instances
Throws:
TwitterException

getUserTimeline

public Status[] getUserTimeline(String id,
                                Integer count,
                                DateTime since,
                                Integer page)
                         throws TwitterException
Returns the 20 most recent statuses posted in the last 24 hours from the authenticating user.

Parameters:
id - Optional. Specifies the ID or screen name of the user for whom to return the friends_timeline.
count - Optional. Specifies the number of statuses to retrieve. May not be greater than 20 for performance purposes.
since - Optional. Narrows the returned results to just those statuses created after the specified HTTP-formatted date.
page - Optional. Retrieves the 20 next most recent direct messages
Returns:
an array of Status instances
Throws:
TwitterException

showStatus

public Status showStatus(long id)
                  throws TwitterException
Returns a single status, specified by the id parameter below. The status's author will be returned inline.

Parameters:
id - Required. The numerical ID of the status you're trying to retrieve.
Returns:
a Status instance
Throws:
TwitterException

updateStatus

public Status updateStatus(String status)
                    throws TwitterException
Updates the authenticating user's status.

Parameters:
status - Required. The text of your status update. Must not be more than 160 characters and should not be more than 140 characters to ensure optimal display.
Returns:
a Status instance
Throws:
TwitterException

getReplies

public Status[] getReplies()
                    throws TwitterException
Returns the 20 most recent replies (status updates prefixed with @username posted by users who are friends with the user being replied to) to the authenticating user. Replies are only available to the authenticating user; you can not request a list of replies to another user whether public or protected.

Returns:
an array of Status instances
Throws:
TwitterException

getReplies

public Status[] getReplies(Integer page)
                    throws TwitterException
Returns the 20 most recent replies (status updates prefixed with @username posted by users who are followers with the user being replied to) to the authenticating user. Replies are only available to the authenticating user; you can not request a list of replies to another user whether public or protected.

Parameters:
page - Optional. Retrieves the 20 next most recent replies.
Returns:
an array of Status instances
Throws:
TwitterException

destroyStatus

public Status destroyStatus(long id)
                     throws TwitterException
Destroys the status specified by the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the author of the specified status.

Parameters:
id - Required. The ID of the status to destroy.
Returns:
a Status instance
Throws:
TwitterException

getFollowing

public User[] getFollowing()
                    throws TwitterException
Returns up to 100 of the people the authenticating user follows who have most recently updated, each with current status inline.

Returns:
An array of User instances
Throws:
TwitterException

getFollowing

public User[] getFollowing(String id)
                    throws TwitterException
Returns up to 100 of the people the authenticating user follows who have most recently updated, each with current status inline.

Parameters:
id - Optional. The ID or screen name of the user for whom to request a list of people they follow
Returns:
An array of User instances
Throws:
TwitterException

                    throws TwitterException
Returns the authenticating user's followers, each with current status inline.

Returns:
An array of User instances
Throws:
TwitterException

getFollowers

public User[] getFollowers(Boolean lite)
                    throws TwitterException
Returns the authenticating user's followers, each with current status inline.

Parameters:
lite - Optional. Prevents the inline inclusion of current status.
Returns:
An array of User instances
Throws:
TwitterException

showUser

public User showUser(String id)
              throws TwitterException
Returns extended information of a given user, specified by ID or screen name as per the required id parameter below.

Parameters:
id - Required. The ID or screen name of a user.
Returns:
A User instance
Throws:
TwitterException

getDirectMessages

public DirectMessage[] getDirectMessages()
                                  throws TwitterException
Returns a list of the 20 most recent direct messages sent to the authenticating user.

Returns:
An array of DirectMessage instances
Throws:
TwitterException

getDirectMessages

public DirectMessage[] getDirectMessages(DateTime since,
                                         String sinceId,
                                         Integer page)
                                  throws TwitterException
Returns a list of the 20 most recent direct messages sent to the authenticating user.

Parameters:
since - Optional. Narrows the resulting list of direct messages to just those sent after the specified HTTP-formatted date.
sinceId - Optional. Returns only direct messages with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.
page - Optional. Retrieves the 20 next most recent direct messages.
Returns:
An array of DirectMessage instances
Throws:
TwitterException

getSentDirectMessages

public DirectMessage[] getSentDirectMessages()
                                      throws TwitterException
Returns a list of the 20 most recent direct messages sent by the authenticating user.

Throws:
TwitterException

getSentDirectMessages

public DirectMessage[] getSentDirectMessages(DateTime since,
                                             String sinceId,
                                             Integer page)
                                      throws TwitterException
Returns a list of the 20 most recent direct messages sent by the authenticating user.

Parameters:
since - Optional. Narrows the resulting list of direct messages to just those sent after the specified HTTP-formatted date.
sinceId - Optional. Returns only sent direct messages with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.
page - Optional. Retrieves the 20 next most recent direct messages sent.
Returns:
An array of DirectMessage instances
Throws:
TwitterException

newDirectMessage

public DirectMessage newDirectMessage(String user,
                                      String text)
                               throws TwitterException
Sends a new direct message to the specified user from the authenticating user.

Parameters:
user - Required. The ID or screen name of the recipient user.
text - Required. The text of your direct message.
Returns:
A DirectMessage instance
Throws:
TwitterException

destroyDirectMessage

public DirectMessage destroyDirectMessage(long id)
                                   throws TwitterException
Destroys the direct message specified in the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the recipient of the specified direct message.

Parameters:
id - Required. The ID of the direct message to destroy.
Returns:
A DirectMessage instance
Throws:
TwitterException

startFollowing

public User startFollowing(String id)
                    throws TwitterException
Adds the user specified in the ID parameter to the list of users that the authenticating user is following.

Parameters:
id - Required. The ID or screen name of the user to start following.
Returns:
A User instance
Throws:
TwitterException

A User instance

TwitterException
